item.title: Jessica add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "Once you have tasted flight, you will forever walk the earth with your eyes turned skyward, for there you have been, and there you will always long to return." -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: Jessica add a quote by George Eliot
item.description: "It is never too late to be what you might have been." -- George Eliot

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "Twas brillig, and the slithy toves Did gyre and gimble in the wabe: All mimsy were the borogoves, And the mome raths outgrabe." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "For most of history, Anonymous was a woman." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Jessica add a quote by George Sand
item.description: "Let us accept truth, even when it surprises us and alters our views." -- George Sand

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Lucy Maud Montgomery
item.description: "Red hair is my life long sorrow." -- Lucy Maud Montgomery

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "Facts do not cease to exist because they are ignored." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Everything must be made as simple as possible. But not simpler." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "Wow, it really snowed last night! Isn't it wonderful? Everything familiar has disappeared! The world looks brand new! A new year ... a fresh, clean start! It's like having a big white sheet of paper to draw on! A day full of possibilities! It's a magical world, Hobbes, ol' buddy ... let's go exploring!" -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi
item.description: "The minute I heard my first love story, I started looking for you, not knowing how blind that was. Lovers don't finally meet somewhere. They're in each other all along." -- Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Anna Quindlen
item.description: "Trying to be perfect may be inevitable for people who are smart and ambitious and interested in the world and its good opinion...What is really hard, and really amazing, is giving up on being perfect and beginning the work of becoming yourself." -- Anna Quindlen

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "She is too fond of books, and it has turned her brain." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Jessica add a quote by L. Frank Baum
item.description: "My world, my world... How can such a good little girl like you destroy all of my beautiful wickedness. - Wicket Witch of the North" -- L. Frank Baum

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Marthe Troly-Curtin
item.description: "Time you enjoy wasting is not wasted time." -- Marthe Troly-Curtin

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "I would always rather be happy than dignified." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Katharine Hepburn
item.description: "If you always do what interests you, at least one person is pleased." -- Katharine Hepburn

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Jennifer Egan
item.description: "Time’s a goon, right? You gonna let that goon push you around?” Scotty shook his head. “The goon won." -- Jennifer Egan

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut Jr.
item.description: "And I urge you to please notice when you are happy, and exclaim or murmur or think at some point, 'If this isn't nice, I don't know what is." -- Kurt Vonnegut Jr.

item.title: Jessica add a quote by William Shakespeare
Jessica add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "The final weapon is the brain, all else is supplemental." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Galileo Galilei
item.description: "I do not feel obliged to believe that the same God who has endowed us with sense, reason, and intellect has intended us to forgo their use." -- Galileo Galilei

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Ira Gershwin
item.description: "The way you wear your hat, The way you sip your tea, The mem'ry of all that -- No, no! They can't take that away from me!" -- Ira Gershwin

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Ira Gershwin
item.description: "Holding hands at midnight 'Neath a starry sky... Nice work if you can get it And you can get it -- if you try." -- Ira Gershwin

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Willa Cather
item.description: "There are some things you learn best in calm, and some in storm." -- Willa Cather

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Francis Bacon
item.description: "A wise man will make more opportunities than he finds." -- Francis Bacon

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Daphne du Maurier
item.description: "I wish I was a woman of about thirty-six dressed in black satin with a string of pearls." -- Daphne du Maurier

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "If you are allergic to a thing, it is best not to put that thing in your mouth, particularly if the thing is cats." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Douglas R. Hofstadter
item.description: "What is an "I", and why are such things found (at least so far) only in association with, as poet Russell Edson once wonderfully phrased it, "teetering bulbs of dread and dream" -- that is, only in association with certain kinds of gooey lumps encased in hard protective shells mounted atop mobile pedestals that roam the world on pairs of slightly fuzzy, jointed stilts?" -- Douglas R. Hofstadter

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Vladimir Nabokov
item.description: "Let all of life be an unfettered howl. Like the crowd greeting the gladiator. Don't stop to think, don't interrupt the scream, exhale, release life's rapture." -- Vladimir Nabokov

item.title: Jessica add a quote by F.R. Leavis
item.description: "Literature is the supreme means by which you renew your sensuous and emotional life and learn a new awareness." -- F.R. Leavis
